content: Historical constituency of Singapore **Nee Soon Central Single Member Constituency** was a [single member constituency](/wiki/Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC) in the [northern](/wiki/North_Region,_Singapore) area of Singapore. The seat consists of Yishun Town Centre (Neighbourhood 9), Neighbourhood 6 and part of Neighbourhood 7. ## History The constituency was formed in 1988 and has been held by the ruling party from 1988 to 1991 when the People's Action Party lost the seat to [Singapore Democratic Party](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party)'s [Cheo Chai Chen](/wiki/Cheo_Chai_Chen) but Cheo lost to Ong Ah Heng of the People's Action Party in the [1997 Singapore general election](/wiki/1997_Singaporean_general_election). Ong was subsequently reelected in 2001 and 2006 before retiring in the [2011 general election](/wiki/2011_Singaporean_general_election). In (/wiki/2011_Singaporean_general_election), the constituency was merged into [Nee Soon Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Nee_Soon_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament YearMember of ParliamentParty**1988**Ng Pock Too[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1991**[Cheo Chai Chen](/wiki/Cheo_Chai_Chen)[SDP](/wiki/Singapore_Democratic_Party)**1997**Ong Ah Heng[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1980s [General Election
